**Using natural materials**: You can use natural materials like baking soda, vinegar, and lemon juice to create natural cleaning agents. Baking soda and vinegar can be used in combination to create a variety of household cleaners. Lemon juice can be used to remove stains and freshen odors.
**Using tea tree oil**: Tea tree oil has antimicrobial properties and can be used as a natural disinfectant to clean surfaces and fight against germs.
**Using salt water**: Salt water can be used to clean wounds and remove dirt from hands and other surfaces. It can also help in preventing infections.
**Creating homemade cleaning sprays**: You can create homemade cleaning sprays using essential oils and water. These sprays can be used to clean surfaces and provide a natural fragrance to your home.
**Using alcohol-based hand sanitizers**: Alcohol-based hand sanitizers can be used when soap and water are not available. They are effective in killing germs and bacteria.
